name_th: วัดพระธาตุดอยสุเทพ
description: Chiang Mai's most iconic temple perched atop Doi Suthep mountain, offering breathtaking panoramic city views and housing a sacred Buddha relic. Visitors can climb 309 steps or take a cable car.
notes: Dress code: shoulders and knees covered. Cable car available for 50 THB.

name_th: อุทยานแห่งชาติดอยอินทนนท์
description: Thailand's highest peak (2,565m) featuring the Royal Twin Pagodas, stunning waterfalls including Wachirathan, hiking trails like Kew Mae Pan, and cool climate year-round.
highlights: Highest Peak,Twin Pagodas,Waterfalls,Kew Mae Pan Trail,Cool Climate
notes: Entrance fee 300 THB for foreigners. Bring warm clothing as it can be cold at the peak.

name_th: อุทยานธรรมชาติช้าง
description: Ethical elephant sanctuary focused on rescue and rehabilitation. Visitors can observe elephants in their natural environment, feed them, and learn about conservation without riding or tricks.
highlights: Elephant Encounters,No Riding,Rescue Stories,Mud Bath,River Time
notes: Booking required in advance. Price includes transportation from Chiang Mai, lunch, guide.

name_th: วัดเจดีย์หลวง
description: 14th-century temple in the Old City featuring an impressive partially-ruined chedi (stupa) and excellent example of Lanna architecture. Once housed the Emerald Buddha.
notes: Monk Chat available daily 09:00-18:00 to learn about Buddhism and Thai culture.

name_th: ตลาดถนนคนเดินวันอาทิตย์
description: Famous weekly market stretching along Rachadamnoen Road in the Old City. Paradise for shoppers and food lovers with handmade crafts, textiles, souvenirs, and amazing street food.
notes: Open Sunday only. Bring cash, wear comfortable shoes. Very crowded but amazing atmosphere.

name_th: ไนท์บาซาร์เชียงใหม่
description: Iconic nightly market along Chang Klan Road featuring hundreds of stalls selling crafts, clothing, jewelry, and delicious local dishes like Khao Soi. Entertainment and massage parlors nearby.
notes: Open daily. Great for souvenirs and local food. Bargaining expected.

latitude: Unique limestone waterfalls where the grippy rocks allow visitors to climb directly up the cascading water. Natural and fun experience away from tourist crowds.
rating: 60km from city center. Entrance 300 THB for foreigners. Wear swimsuit, bring towel.

name_th: แกรนด์แคนยอนเชียงใหม่
description: Former limestone quarry transformed into adventure water park. Offers swimming, cliff jumping (5-10m), zip-lining, kayaking, and inflatable obstacle course.
notes: Life jackets mandatory and included. Food and drinks available. Popular with young travelers.

name_th: โรงเรียนสอนทำอาหาร
description: Highly-rated cooking school offering hands-on classes to learn authentic Thai cuisine. Includes market visit, farm tour, and cooking 5-7 dishes to take home the recipes.
highlights: Market Visit,Organic Farm,Hands-on Cooking,Recipe Book,Lunch Included
notes: Booking required. Price includes transport, ingredients, recipes. Vegetarian options available.

name_th: วัดพระสิงห์
description: One of Chiang Mai's most venerated temples featuring classic Lanna architecture and housing the revered Phra Singh Buddha statue. Beautiful murals and intricate wood carvings.
notes: Active Buddhist temple. Respectful dress required.

name_th: นิมมานเหมินท์
description: Hip and trendy area popular with digital nomads, students, and tourists. Features cool cafes, boutique shops, art galleries, coworking spaces, and vibrant nightlife.
notes: Popular area for Instagram-worthy cafes. MAYA Lifestyle Shopping Center is the main mall.

name_th: เส้นทางพระ
name_en: Monk's Trail to Wat Pha Lat
description: Serene jungle hiking trail (2-3km) leading to the hidden temple of Wat Pha Lat. Continues up to Doi Suthep. Beautiful forest setting with streams and statues along the way.
highlights: Jungle Hike,Hidden Temple,Peaceful,Photo Spots,Continue to Doi Suthep
notes: Free entry. Wear proper hiking shoes. From Wat Pha  Lat, can continue 2.5km up to Doi Suthep.

description: Authentic local market providing a true taste of Northern Thai life. Wide variety of fresh produce, flowers, Northern Thai snacks, and handicrafts. Less touristy than night markets.
notes: Open daily. Great for authentic local food and shopping. Much cheaper than tourist markets.

description: Multi-day or day trekking adventures through lush jungles visiting Karen and Lahu hill tribe villages. Includes bamboo rafting, waterfall visits, and cultural homestays.
data_source: Prices vary by operator and duration. Book with reputable companies. Fitness level required.

name_th: ตลาดนัดเปลื้องเรือดี
description: Lively night market with great atmosphere, diverse street food, shopping, and entertainment including live dance shows. Popular with locals and tourists.
notes: Open Tuesday-Sunday. Great food variety. Live entertainment on weekends.

name_th: วัดเชียงมั่น
description: Chiang Mai's oldest temple founded in 1297. Houses important Buddha images including Phra Sila and crystal Buddha Sae Tang Khamani. Beautiful elephant-supported chedi.
notes: Free for Thais, 20 THB for foreigners. Quieter than other major temples.

description: Thrilling zipline adventure through lush rainforest canopy. Over 30 platforms, longest zipline 800m. Professional guides, safety equipment, and hotel transfers included.
notes: Booking required. Min age 4, max weight 125kg. Hotel pickup included. Very professional operation.

name_th: คลองแม่ข่า
description: Recently revitalized historic canal running through Old City. Picturesque walking path with renovated areas, local cafes, temples, and glimpses of authentic Chiang Mai life.
notes: Free. Nice for leisurely walks. Several hip cafes along the canal. Great for photography.
